intro: Macrocnemum cuencanum, commonly known as the Cuencan wildbean, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers, which contribute to its ecological significance in supporting local pollinators.
